intro: Thlaspi yunnanense var. dentatum, commonly known as the Yunnan cress, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many species of mustard and cress. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, thriving in well-drained soils. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
